channel.title: Comments on: Rashid’s Socialize Button
channel.description: Don't document the program; program the document.

item.title: By: Gwen
item.dc:creator: Gwen
item.description: Hi Rashid, you must have caught it exactly in a moment I was trying an other one. I had this one installed: RA-Socialize Button. In any case, I found one that displays on my website now, so don't worry :-)
item.content:encoded: Hi Rashid, you must have caught it exactly in a moment I was trying an other one. I had this one installed: RA-Socialize Button. In any case, I found one that displays on my website now, so don’t worry ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The plugin which is activated on your site is not mine. Please uninstall all other plugins and then install and activate this plugin.
item.content:encoded: The plugin which is activated on your site is not mine. Please uninstall all other plugins and then install and activate this plugin.

item.title: By: Gwen
item.dc:creator: Gwen
item.description: Hi Rashid, I tried a few other plugins before I got to yours and it's great to find it working in version 3.5.1 of WordPress! I have a question, on the WP version of the blog the plugin works fine http://www.awarenessclinic.co.uk/news/ but this blog is integrated into an existing website, see http://www.awarenessclinic.co.uk/news.php. The FB link shows fine, but the Twitter and G+ are not displaying properly. I have a feeling that I need to edit the path to the image in de editor, could you help me in the right direction so Twitter and G+ will display properly also on my website? Ta!
item.content:encoded: Hi Rashid, I tried a few other plugins before I got to yours and it’s great to find it working in version 3.5.1 of WordPress! I have a question, on the WP version of the blog the plugin works fine http://www.awarenessclinic.co.uk/news/ but this blog is integrated into an existing website, see http://www.awarenessclinic.co.uk/news.php. The FB link shows fine, but the Twitter and G+ are not displaying properly. I have a feeling that I need to edit the path to the image in de editor, could you help me in the right direction so Twitter and G+ will display properly also on my website? Ta!

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
Hi,
Thanks for using my plugin.
I have made necessary changes in the plugin to meet your requirement, but due to some problem with wordpress I am not able to upload my updated plugin to their server. Once I upload the plugin you just need to update it. Then you will get an option to select the position of the buttons.
I hope it will help you.
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

Thanks for using my plugin.

I have made necessary changes in the plugin to meet your requirement, but due to some problem with wordpress I am not able to upload my updated plugin to their server. Once I upload the plugin you just need to update it. Then you will get an option to select the position of the buttons.

I hope it will help you.

item.title: By: Ed Mendel
item.dc:creator: Ed Mendel
item.description:
Hi Rashid.
How can I set the Rashid Socialize Button at top of my post (and not at bottom like default)??
Thanks.. EdMendel Brazil
item.content:encoded:
Hi Rashid.

How can I set the Rashid Socialize Button at top of my post (and not at bottom like default)??

Thanks..
EdMendel
Brazil

item.title: By: Norm
item.dc:creator: Norm
item.description:
The plugin seems to work OK in WordPress. It shows how many people "like" the post, but nothing seems to happen in Facebook itself. I post a link to the blogpost in Facebook, and people who like it in Facebook show up there, but the count in Facebook doesn't reflect the count in the plugin. Is there no actual connection between the plugin and Facebook? When people "like" the post on my blog, does their "like" show up anywhere else?
Thanks, Norm
item.content:encoded:
The plugin seems to work OK in WordPress. It shows how many people “like” the post, but nothing seems to happen in Facebook itself. I post a link to the blogpost in Facebook, and people who like it in Facebook show up there, but the count in Facebook doesn’t reflect the count in the plugin. Is there no actual connection between the plugin and Facebook? When people “like” the post on my blog, does their “like” show up anywhere else?

Thanks,
Norm

item.title: By: Ronald
item.dc:creator: Ronald
item.description:
Hi Rashid, I like your plugin, but I've got two issues: if I click on "Tweet" on my blogroll, Twitter wants to tweet my webpage, in stead of the particular post under which the icon is displayed. When I click on the title of a post (post = cartoon in my case), to open it, and then click on the tweet icon, twitter wants to tweet the post - which is what I would like to do.
Further: amount of likes in Facebook appears to be higher than mentioned under my posts.
Best Regards, Ronald
item.content:encoded:
Hi Rashid, I like your plugin, but I’ve got two issues: if I click on “Tweet” on my blogroll, Twitter wants to tweet my webpage, in stead of the particular post under which the icon is displayed. When I click on the title of a post (post = cartoon in my case), to open it, and then click on the tweet icon, twitter wants to tweet the post – which is what I would like to do.

Further: amount of likes in Facebook appears to be higher than mentioned under my posts.

Best Regards,
Ronald

item.title: By: David
item.dc:creator: David
item.description: Nice looking buttons - can they show the total likes and +1s ect?
item.content:encoded: Nice looking buttons – can they show the total likes and +1s ect?

item.title: By: Rashid Azar
item.dc:creator: Rashid Azar
item.description: It seems your theme is not compatible. There is no issue from wordpress side.
item.content:encoded: It seems your theme is not compatible. There is no issue from wordpress side.

item.title: By: Liz
item.dc:creator: Liz
item.description:
Hi Rashid,
Your Socialize plug-in was working before, but no longer does. I tried updating Suffusion (theme), but that didn't solve the problem. I am using the latest Wordpress version. Any ideas?
TIA, Liz
item.content:encoded:
Hi Rashid,

Your Socialize plug-in was working before, but no longer does. I tried updating Suffusion (theme), but that didn’t solve the problem. I am using the latest WordPress version. Any ideas?

TIA,
Liz
